definition: to put into practice/to carry out (idiom)
to pay/to hand over to/classifier for pairs or sets of things
to grant/to give/to bestow/to act/to carry out

sentences.english: But now we have to execute, not only say the words.
sentences.chinese: 但我們要付諸實施，不能停留在口頭上。

sentences.english: But that’s hard advice to put into practice sometimes.
sentences.chinese: 可是有時候這是個難以付諸實施的建議。

sentences.english: But information wasn't enough to pull off an insider-trading plan. Ms.
sentences.chinese: 不過僅僅有信息還不足以讓內部交易計劃付諸實施。

sentences.english: Mr. Kugelmass, the worst thing you could do is act out.
sentences.chinese: 庫馬思，你能做的最糟的事兒莫過於付諸實施。
第三步，作計劃付諸實施。

sentences.english: We need. a quota system to help us put change into effect.
sentences.chinese: 我們需要配額制來幫助把這一變化付諸實施。

sentences.english: We now decide to implement the recommendations.
sentences.chinese: 現在我們決定將建議付諸實施。

sentences.english: The issue is whether and how these ideas will be translated into practice.
sentences.chinese: 問題是這些想法能否和將如何被付諸實施。

sentences.english: What they did this week, they should've done last.
sentences.chinese: 他們這周所採取的行動應該在上週就付諸實施。
